citeinfo.title: Public Waters (PW) Basin and Watercourse Delineations

pubinfo.publish: MNDNR - Division of Ecological and Water Resources

descript.purpose: These data were developed as an aid in making regulatory decisions regarding Public Waters Basins and Watercourses.

timeperd.current: Time Period of Content date indicates the date which the user can be confident of accuracy and completeness of the dataset.

theme.themekey: inlandWaters, Hydrography, Water, Public Waters, Basins, Watercourses, Regulation

idinfo.useconst: These are provisional data. Users are expected to contact the appropriate Area and Regional Hydrologist before taking any actions that may affect a regulated basin or watercourse. Area Hydrologist phone numbers can be found at: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/contact/locator.html See the MNDNR Permitting and Reporting System (MPARS): http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/mpars/index.html to file a Public Waters Work permit. Use of the data are constrained only by the MNDNR GIS Data License Agreement. See the Distribution Liability section below for a link.

citeinfo.title: This is one of the major feature classes in the DNR Hydrography SDE Dataset

procstep.procdesc: Waterbodies and watercourses were identified from scanned paper Public Waters Inventory (PWI) maps and digitized from current aerial photography.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number for each stream route feature in DNR Hydrography SDE - Stream Route Centerlines (GIS-calculated.)

Unique Fisheries Watercourse ID for joining/linking stream routes to DNR Fisheries Stream Survey Oracle DB. FW_IDs are assigned based on how the watercourse is managed by DNR Fisheries (an FW_ID may correspond to an entire stream or portion of a stream.) Dummy (invalid) Kittle Numbers have FW_ID = 0.

Watercourse ID per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database. A valid KITTLE_NBR has a drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' (See VALID = Y, below). A dummy KITTLE_NBR has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' (See VALID = N, below).
Stream Name per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database
Length of entire stream route in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for starting (downstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for ending (upstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Length of linear feature in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
Flag denoting whether entire watercourse route is a Public Waters watercourse.
Flag to identify validity of assigned Kittle Numbers

edom.edomvd: Dummy (invalid) Kittle Number assigned by DNR Fisheries; has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' where MAJXXXX represents the 4-digit code for the HUC04 drainage and -xxxxx is a unique, sequential number. Dummy Kittle Numbers usually pertain to small unmanaged streams and streams outside of MN.

Valid Kittle Number assigned by DNR Fisheries; has a valid drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' where X identifies the major drainage (H-Hudson Bay, I-Iowa/Cedar River, M-Mississippi River, S-Lake Superior) and '-000-000-000...' is a branching identifier that lengthens as you move upstream. Valid Kittle Numbers usually pertain to major streams and/or streams that have had some type of DNR management.

attr.attrdef: A concatenation of Kittle Name + (Kittle Number) for labeling purposes
Date the GIS layer was published or updated and re-published.
A county-based code denoting a specific segment of a Public Waters watercourse.
A code denoting the type of Public Watercourse

edom.edomvd: Public Water Altered Natural Watercourse (includes ditches)

attr.attrdef: Text description of PWI_FLAG
Flag denoting whether watercourse has a drainage area > two square miles at its mouth
Flag denoting whether watercourse has a drainage area > five square miles at its mouth
The sum total of drainage area upstream ofat its mouth
Catchment ID (DNR Level 09 Autocatchments) that contains the mouth of the Public Waters watercourse. The total upstream drainage area (UPSUM_SQMI) is calculated from (and includes) this catchment.
Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Public Water Basin Features
Unique ID in DNR EWR LakesDB master database
Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin
Public Waters Basin name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Public Waters Basin parent name (corresponding to DOWLKNUMs ending in '00') per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Public Waters Basin sub-basin name (corresponding to DOWLKNUMs not ending in '00') per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Flag denoting whether the delineation represents an entire basin '00' or sub-basin '01','02', etc.
Wetland Type per EWR LAKESDB database
Public Waters class per EWR LAKESDB database
Text description of PWI_CLASS
Surface water acreage of Public Waters basin (corresponding to the OHW-Ordinary HIgh Water Level). This acreage is often greater than the open water as seen on aerail photography
Shoreline length in miles, corresponding to OHW delineation. Includes shoreline around islands.

distinfo.distliab: Please read accompanying document: Minnesota DNR Data and Software License Agreement.pdf

stdorder.ordering: Visit the web site noted in the online linkage section, or send an email to the Distribution Contact listed in this metadata record
